title: Trait impls using associated types of a type defined in another crate cause confusing "conflicting implementations" error although implementations don't actually conflict

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I tried this code:

* `Cargo.toml`
```toml
[workspace]
members = ["a", "b"]
```

* `a/Cargo.toml`
```toml
[package]
name = "a"
version = "0.1.0"
edition = "2021"
[dependencies]
```
* `b/Cargo.toml`
```toml
[package]
name = "b"
version = "0.1.0"
edition = "2021"
[dependencies]
a = { path = "../a" }
```

* `a/src/lib.rs`
```rust
pub trait Foo {
    type Bar;
}

pub trait Baz<T> {}

pub struct T;
impl Foo for T {
    type Bar = f32;
}
```

* `b/src/lib.rs`:
```rust
use a::{Baz, Foo};

pub struct S;

impl Foo for S {
    type Bar = u32;
}

impl Baz<i32> for S {}
impl Baz<<a::T as Foo>::Bar> for S {}
```

I expected to see this happen: It either would work fine, or the error message would be more exact and pointing out that this is not allowed because `a::T` is defined in another trait. There is not actual conflict here, just a potential conflict that can be caused by `a` changing the implementation later.

Instead, this happened:

```
error[E0119]: conflicting implementations of trait `a::Baz<i32>` for type `S`
  --> b/src/lib.rs:10:1
   |
9  | impl Baz<i32> for S {}
   | ------------------- first implementation here
10 | impl Baz<<a::T as Foo>::Bar> for S {}
   | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ conflicting implementation for `S`

```

Note that this works perfectly fine if everything is in a single crate, or if `b` uses e.g. `<S as Foo>::Bar` instead.

### Meta
`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.64.0 (a55dd71d5 2022-09-19)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: a55dd71d5fb0ec5a6a3a9e8c27b2127ba491ce52
commit-date: 2022-09-19
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.64.0
LLVM version: 14.0.6
```
